de.eckhartarnold.client
Class Caption 

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              de.eckhartarnold.client.Caption
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, ResizeListener, SlideshowListener 
public class Caption
				
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
				
implements SlideshowListener, ResizeListener

Displays the image caption of the currently displayed slide of a Slideshow.

The caption may contain simple text or HTML code.

Constructor Detail

Caption

public Caption(Slideshow slideshow,
               java.lang.String[] captions)
Creates a new Caption object. The captions parameter must contain the caption strings for the images of the slideshow in the same order as the images in the slide show.

Parameters:
slideshow - the Slideshow for which the captions are to be displayed
captions - an array of string that contains the HTML formatted captions. The length of the array must be the same as number of images in the slide show.
Method Detail

clone

public Caption clone()
Clones the Caption object. Cloning captions is used by CaptionOverlay in order to imitate shadowed text, which unfortunately most browsers do not support natively.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

getFontSize

public int getFontSize()
Returns the font size of the caption.

Returns:
font size in pixel

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Returns the current Text the caption displays.

Returns:
the HTML formatted Text of the caption

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns true, if the caption is empty (at the moment).

isSpacing

public boolean isSpacing()
Returns true, if spacers (" ") are used as a substitute for the caption string, in case the caption is empty.

onFade

public void onFade()
Description copied from interface: SlideshowListener
Called when a new image starts fading in. The number of the image that is faded in can be queried via Slideshow.getCurrentSlide onFade() will not be called if fading is disabled or skipped for some other reason!

Specified by:
onFade in interface SlideshowListener

onShow

public void onShow(int slideNr)
Description copied from interface: SlideshowListener
Called whenever a new slide is displayed. onShow is only called after fading in has finished and the slide is fully displayed.

Specified by:
onShow in interface SlideshowListener
Parameters:
slideNr - the number of the slide that is (fully) displayed right now.

onResized

public void onResized()
Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
Called after a parent widget has been resized.

Specified by:
onResized in interface ResizeListener

prepareResized

public void prepareResized()
Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
Called after a parent widget has been resized, but before the new size is processed via onResized . The method prepareResized is needed to allow composite widgets that contain absolute panels to temporarily detach these absolute panels in order to allow the browser to calculate widget sizes correctly. The implementation of onResized can then re-attach the detached absolute panels. Methods prepareResized and onResized should therefore always be used in conjunction.

Specified by:
prepareResized in interface ResizeListener

setSpacing

public void setSpacing(boolean on)
Sets the usage of a spacer (e.g. " ") whenever the caption is empty. Otherwise the caption is simply omitted. Spacers are needed in some cases in order to preserve the screen layout. By default the use of a spacer is turned on.

Parameters:
on - true, if a spacer (" ") shall be used.
